com.biorecorder.edflib

Class EdfFileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biorecorder.edflib.EdfFileReader

  • public class EdfFileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Permits to read data samples from EDF or BDF file. Also it reads information from the file header and saves it in special HeaderInfo object, that we can get by method getHeader()

    EDF/BDF files contains "row" digital (int) data but they can be converted to corresponding real physical floating point data on the base of header information (physical maximum and minimum and digital maximum and minimum specified for every channel (signal)). So we can "read" both digital or physical values. See: readDigitalSamples(int, int[], int, int), readPhysicalSamples(int, double[], int, int) readDigitalDataRecord(int[]), readPhysicalDataRecord(double[]).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EdfFileReader(java.io.File file)
      Creates EdfFileReader to read data from the file represented by the specified File object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EdfFileReader

        public EdfFileReader(java.io.File file)
              throws FileNotFoundRuntimeException,
                     java.lang.SecurityException,
                     EdfHeaderParsingRuntimeException
        Creates EdfFileReader to read data from the file represented by the specified File object. Before create EdfFileReader you can check if the file is valid EdF/Bdf file: isReadableValidEdfFile(File)
        Parameters:
        file - Edf or Bdf file to be opened for reading
        Throws:
        EdfHeaderParsingRuntimeException - if the header record of the file is not valid EDF/BDF file header
        FileNotFoundRuntimeException - Runtime wrapper of FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and does not permit to read the file

    • Method Detail

      • isReadableValidEdfFile

        public static boolean isReadableValidEdfFile(java.io.File file)
        Checks if the given file is a readable and valid Edf or Bdf file.
        Returns:
        true if the file exist, can be read and is valid Edf/Bdf file

      • setDataRecordPosition

        public void setDataRecordPosition(int newPosition)
        Set the DataRecords position indicator to the given new position. The position is measured in DataRecords. Methods readDigitalDataRecord(int[]) and readPhysicalDataRecord(double[]) will start reading from the specified position.
        Parameters:
        newPosition - the new position, a non-negative integer counting the number of DataRecords from the beginning of the file

      • setSamplePosition

        public void setSamplePosition(int signalNumber,
                              long newPosition)
        Set the sample position indicator of the given channel (signal) to the given new position. The position is measured in samples.

        Note that every signal has it's own independent sample position indicator and setSamplePosition() affects only one of them. Methods readDigitalSamples(int, int[], int, int) and readPhysicalSamples(int, double[], int, int) will start reading samples belonging to a channel from the specified for that channel position.

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose sample position we change. Numbering starts from 0!
        newPosition - the new sample position, a non-negative integer counting the number of samples belonging to the specified channel from the beginning of the file

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Puts DataRecord position indicator and sample position indicators of all signals to 0.

      • getDataRecordPosition

        public int getDataRecordPosition()
        Return the current DataRecord position. The position is measured in DataRecords.
        Returns:
        current DataRecord position, a non-negative integer counting the number of DataRecords from the beginning of the file

      • getSamplePosition

        public long getSamplePosition(int signalNumber)
        Return the current sample position of the given channel (signal). The position is measured in samples.
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose position we want to get. Numbering starts from 0!
        Returns:
        current sample position, a non-negative integer counting the number of samples belonging to the given channel from the beginning of the file

      • readDigitalDataRecord

        public int readDigitalDataRecord(int[] buffer)
                          throws IORuntimeException
        Reads the "raw" digital (integer) values corresponding to ONE DataRecord and store them in the given buffer array. Reading starts from the specified DataRecord position. The DataRecords position indicator will be increased with 1.
        Parameters:
        buffer - array where read samples will be stored
        Returns:
        the amount of read samples (this can be less than buffer.length or zero!)
        Throws:
        IORuntimeException - if data could not be read

      • readPhysicalDataRecord

        public int readPhysicalDataRecord(double[] buffer)
                           throws IORuntimeException
        Reads the samples corresponding to ONE DataRecord, converts them to their physical values (e.g. microVolts, beats per minute, etc) and store the resultant physical values in the given buffer array. Reading starts from the specified DataRecord position. The DataRecords position indicator will be increased with 1.
        Parameters:
        buffer - array where resultant physical samples will be stored
        Returns:
        the amount of read samples (this can be less than buffer.length or zero!)
        Throws:
        IORuntimeException - if data could not be read

      • readDigitalSamples

        public int readDigitalSamples(int signalNumber,
                              int[] buffer,
                              int offset,
                              int numberOfSamples)
                       throws IORuntimeException
        Read the given number of samples belonging to the channel starting from the current sample position indicator. The values are the "raw" digital (integer) values. The sample position indicator of that channel will be increased with the amount of samples read. Read samples are saved in the specified array starting at the specified offset. Return the amount of read samples (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose samples must be read. Numbering starts from 0!
        buffer - buffer where read samples are saved
        offset - offset within the buffer array at which saving starts
        numberOfSamples - number of samples to read
        Returns:
        the amount of read samples (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Throws:
        IORuntimeException - if data can not be read

      • readDigitalSamples

        public int readDigitalSamples(int signalNumber,
                              int[] buffer)
                       throws IORuntimeException
        Read the samples belonging to the channel starting from the current sample position indicator. Number of samples to read = buffer.length. Do the same as readDigitalSamples(signalNumber, buffer, 0, buffer.length);

        The values are the "raw" digital (integer) values. The sample position indicator of that channel will be increased with the amount of samples read. Read samples are saved in the specified array starting at the specified offset. Return the amount of read samples (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose samples must be read. Numbering starts from 0!
        buffer - buffer where read samples are saved
        Returns:
        the amount of read samples (this can be less than buffer.length or zero!)
        Throws:
        IORuntimeException - if data can not be read

      • readPhysicalSamples

        public int readPhysicalSamples(int signalNumber,
                               double[] buffer,
                               int offset,
                               int numberOfSamples)
                        throws IORuntimeException
        Read the given number of samples belonging to the channel starting from the current sample position indicator. Converts the read samples to their physical values (e.g. microVolts, beats per minute, etc) and saves them in the specified buffer array starting at the specified offset. The sample position indicator of that channel will be increased with the amount of samples read. Return the amount of read samples (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose samples must be read. Numbering starts from 0!
        buffer - buffer where resultant values are saved
        offset - offset within the buffer array at which saving starts
        numberOfSamples - number of samples to read
        Returns:
        the amount of read samples (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)
        Throws:
        IORuntimeException - if data can not be read

      • readPhysicalSamples

        public int readPhysicalSamples(int signalNumber,
                               double[] buffer)
                        throws IORuntimeException
        Read the samples belonging to the channel starting from the current sample position indicator. Number of samples to read = buffer.length. Do the same as readPhysicalSamples(signalNumber, buffer, 0, buffer.length);

        Converts the read samples to their physical values (e.g. microVolts, beats per minute, etc) and saves them in the specified buffer array starting at the specified offset. The sample position indicator of that channel will be increased with the amount of samples read. Return the amount of read samples (this can be less than given numberOfSamples or zero!)

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - channel (signal) number whose samples must be read. Numbering starts from 0!
        buffer - buffer where resultant values are saved
        Returns:
        the amount of read samples (this can be less than buffer.length or zero!)
        Throws:
        IORuntimeException

      • getHeader

        public HeaderInfo getHeader()
        Return the information from the file header stored in the HeaderInfo object
        Returns:
        the object containing EDF/BDF header information

      • rewriteHeader

        public void rewriteHeader(HeaderInfo headerInfo)
                   throws IORuntimeException
        On the base of information from the given config object a new header will be created and rewritten to the file. Note that the number of channels (signals) can not be changed!
        Parameters:
        headerInfo - config object containing info for the new header
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of channels in the new HeaderInfo object does not equal the number of channels in the existent one
        IORuntimeException - if the new header failed to be written

      • availableDataRecords

        public int availableDataRecords()
        Get the number of DataRecords available for reading (from the current DataRecord position).
        availableDataRecords() = getNumberOfDataRecords() - getDataRecordPosition();
        Returns:
        number of available for reading DataRecords

      • availableSamples

        public long availableSamples(int signalNumber)
        Get the number of samples of the given channel (signal) available for reading (from the current sample position set for that signal)
        availableSamples(sampleNumberToSignalNumber) = getNumberOfSamples(sampleNumberToSignalNumber) - getSamplePosition(sampleNumberToSignalNumber);
        Returns:
        number of samples of the given signal available for reading

      • getNumberOfDataRecords

        public int getNumberOfDataRecords()
        Calculate and get the total number of DataRecords in the file.
        getNumberOfDataRecords() = availableDataRecords() + getDataRecordPosition();
        Returns:
        total number of DataRecords in the file

      • getNumberOfSamples

        public long getNumberOfSamples(int signalNumber)
        Calculate and get the total number of samples of the given channel (signal) in the file.
        getNumberOfSamples(sampleNumberToSignalNumber) = availableSamples(sampleNumberToSignalNumber) + getSamplePosition(sampleNumberToSignalNumber);
        Returns:
        total number of samples of the given signal in the file

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IORuntimeException
        Close this EdfFileReader and releases any system resources associated with it. This method MUST be called after finishing reading DataRecords. Failing to do so will cause unnessesary memory usage and corrupted and incomplete data writing.
        Throws:
        IORuntimeException - if EdfFileReader fails to close
